member.name: T:PeanutButter.Utils.AutoDeleter
member.summary: Provides a mechanism to autmatically delete one or more files using the IDisposable pattern. Use this when you'd like to clean up some temporary files after an operation completes without having to worry about exception handling, etc. Files which cannot be deleted (eg: locked for reading / writing) will be left behind. No exceptions are thrown. Files which have been removed in the interim do not cause any exceptions.

member.param: Params array of paths to delete upon disposal

member.summary: Adds zero or more paths to the list to delete upon disposal
member.param: Params array of paths to add to the list to delete upon disposal

member.name: T:PeanutButter.Utils.AutoResetter
member.summary: Provides a mechanism to run code on construction and disposal, irrespective of exception handling Use this, for example, to set up and tear down state required for a test -- your constructionAction is called immediately upon construction and the using() pattern guarantees that your disposalAction is called at disposal, even if your test fails.

member.summary: Constructs a new AutoResetter and immediately runs the constructionAction
member.param: Action to run at construction time
Action to run at disposal time

member.name: T:PeanutButter.Utils.AutoResetter`1
member.summary: Provides a mechanism to run code on construction and disposal, irrespective of exception handling Use this, for example, to set up and tear down state required for a test -- your constructionAction is called immediately upon construction and the using() pattern guarantees that your disposalAction is called at disposal, even if your test fails. This is the variant of AutoResetter where: 1. The start Func returns a value 2. Upon disposal, the end action is called with the value from (1)
member.typeparam: Type of value which is passed to the start and end actions

member.summary: Construcst a new AutoResetter, runs the start Func and stores the result
member.param: Code to run at disposal; will receive the result provided from the start Func

member.name: T:PeanutButter.Utils.DeepEqualityTester
member.summary: Provides a mechanism to test deep-equality of two objects with an optional list of properties to ignore by name. Deep equality testing bypasses reference-checking of container objects and compares primitive propertyt values. Use this to test whether or not two objects essentially contain the same data. More conveniently, use the following extension methods: - DeepEquals -> performs default deep equality testing - DeepSubEquals -> tests if one object matches another, for all the properties that the first has in common with the second - DeepIntersectionEquals -> tests deep equality only on properties which can be matched by name and type

member.summary: Toggle whether or not to record equality errors

member.name: P:PeanutButter.Utils.DeepEqualityTester.FailOnMissingProperties
member.summary: Toggle whether or not equality testing fails when properties found on the first object are not found on the corresponding other object

member.name: P:PeanutButter.Utils.DeepEqualityTester.OnlyTestIntersectingProperties
member.summary: Toggle whether or not to only test properties found on both objects

member.name: P:PeanutButter.Utils.DeepEqualityTester.Errors
member.summary: Provides a list of errors for diagnosing inequality, if RecordErrors has been set to true

member.name: P:PeanutButter.Utils.DeepEqualityTester.IncludeFields
member.summary: Flag: include fields in deep equality testing (false by default)

member.name: P:PeanutButter.Utils.DeepEqualityTester.OnlyCompareShape
member.summary: Toggle only testing the shape of the objects provided.

member.name: P:PeanutButter.Utils.DeepEqualityTester.VerbosePropertyMismatchErrors
member.summary: Include full object dumps when storing errors about property mismatches

member.name: T:PeanutButter.Utils.MetadataExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods to set and retrieve metadata on any object. Under the hood, these methods use a ConditionalWeakTable to store your metadata, so the metadata is garbage-collected when your managed objects are garbage-collected.

member.name: M:PeanutButter.Utils.MetadataExtensions.SetMetadata(System.Object,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Sets an arbitrary piece of metadata on a managed object. This metadata has the same lifetime as your object, meaning it will be garbage-collected when your object is garbage-collected, assuming nothing else is referencing it.
member.param: Name of the metadata item to set

member.name: M:PeanutButter.Utils.MetadataExtensions.GetMetadata``1(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve a piece of metadata for an object. When the metadata key for the object is unknown, returns the default value for the type requested, eg 0 for ints, null for strings and objects. Note that if metadata exists for the requested key but not for the type requested, a type-casting exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:PeanutButter.Utils.MetadataExtensions.GetMetadata``1(System.Object,System.String,``0)
member.summary: Attempts to retrieve a piece of metadata for an object. When the metadata key for the object is unknown, returns the default value for the type requested, eg 0 for ints, null for strings and objects. Note that if metadata exists for the requested key but not for the type requested, a type-casting exception will be thrown. This overload allows specifying a default value.

member.name: M:PeanutButter.Utils.MetadataExtensions.HasMetadata``1(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Tests if a parent object has a piece of metadata with the provided type.
